Classification of Statistical Pearson diagrams

Problem: There is a set of typical statistical diagrams. How to sort them fast and automatically?

Image processing: 1. Feature extraction from an image by pretrained CNN ResNet50 without the last layer 2. Filtration of low informative features 3. Smooth reduction of feature space dimension: PCA + UMAP 4. Clustering and sorting images by HDBSCAN

Dependencies:

Python modules - torch, torchvision - sklearn - umap - hdbscan - pandas, numpy - tqdm (progress bar) - matplotlib, seaborn

Pearson diagrams are obtained from Solar Orbiter RPW-TDS data. For more details see

V.Annenkov, C.Krafft, A.Volokitin, and P.Savoini Statistical properties of beam-driven upper-hybrid wave turbulence in the solar wind, submitted to A&A

The example of a diargam is below.

The example of results:

 10import pandas as pd
 11import numpy as np
 12import os
 13import re
 14from PIL import Image
 15
 16from torchvision import models, transforms
 17import torch
 18from tqdm import tqdm
 19from sklearn.feature_selection import VarianceThreshold
 20from sklearn.metrics import pairwise_distances
 21import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
 22
 23from functools import cached_property
 24from dataclasses import dataclass, field
 25
 26from libservice import ServiceFuncs
 27
 28@dataclass
 29class ResNetFeatures:
 30
 31    """
 32    Extracts deep features from image datasets using torchvision model ResNet50,
 33    merges them with metadata, and provides filtering and analysis tools.
 34
 35    Attributes
 36    ----------
 37    path : str
 38        Path to the folder containing image files.
 39    info_path : str
 40        Path to the metadata text file with observation parameters.
 41    flag : str
 42        Mode of operation: 'read' to load precomputed database, 'extract' to generate it from images.
 43    device : str
 44        Computation device to use ('cuda' or 'cpu').
 45    filter_mixed : bool
 46        Whether to filter out mixed-frequency datasets.
 47    name_pattern : str
 48        Regex pattern to extract dataset names from image filenames.
 49    extra_params : dict
 50        Additional parameters for database loading/saving.
 51    """
 52
 53    path: str
 54    info_path: str = './data/SOLO_info_rswf.txt'
 55    flag: str = 'read'
 56    device: str = 'cuda'
 57    filter_mixed: bool = True
 58    name_pattern: str = r'(solo_L2_rpw-tds-surv-(?:r|t)swf-e_\d+\w+)'
 59    extra_params: dict = field(default_factory=dict)
 60
 61    # inner filed, will be initialized later
 62    _device: torch.device = field(init=False)
 63    names: list = field(init=False)
 64    img_path: list = field(init=False)
 65    info: dict = field(init=False)
 66    database: object = field(init=False)
 67    
 68    def __post_init__(self):
 69        """
 70        Initializes internal fields, filters images, and loads or creates the feature database.
 71        """
 72
 73        self.set_device()
 74
 75        self.names = [f for f in os.listdir(self.path) if ServiceFuncs.check_extension(f)]
 76        self.img_path = [os.path.join(self.path, name) for name in self.names]
 77
 78        self.info = ServiceFuncs.load_info(self.info_path)
 79
 80        if self.filter_mixed:
 81            self.filtering_imgs(self.path, self.name_pattern)
 82
 83        if self.flag == 'read':
 84            self.database = ServiceFuncs.read_database(**self.extra_params)
 85        elif self.flag == 'extract':
 86            self.database = self.create_database()
 87            ServiceFuncs.save_database(self.database, **self.extra_params)
 88        else:
 89            raise ValueError(f'Unknown flag: {self.flag}')
 90        
 91    def set_device(self):
 92        """
 93        Sets torch.device according to a user wish self.device if it is available
 94        or CPU if it is not.
 95        """
 96        if self.device == 'cuda' and not torch.cuda.is_available():
 97            print('CUDA requested but not available. Falling back to CPU.')
 98            self._device = torch.device('cpu')
 99        else:
100            self._device = torch.device(self.device)
101        print(f'Using device: {self._device}')
102
103    @cached_property
104    def model(self):
105        """
106        Loads and caches the model and input transformation.
107        
108        Returns
109        -------
110        tuple
111            A tuple (model, transform) where model is a torch.nn.Module and transform is a torchvision transform pipeline.
112        """
113        transform = transforms.Compose([
114        transforms.Resize((224)),
115        transforms.ToTensor(),
116        transforms.Normalize(
117        mean=[0.485, 0.456, 0.406], 
118        std=[0.229, 0.224, 0.225])
119                                    ])
120
121        model_resnet50 = models.resnet50(weights=models.ResNet50_Weights.DEFAULT)
122        model_resnet50 = torch.nn.Sequential(*list(model_resnet50.children())[:-1])  # without the last layer
123        model_resnet50.to(self._device)
124
125        return model_resnet50, transform
126
127    def find_mixed_freq(self):
128        """
129        Identifies dataset names with mixed sampling frequencies in the metadata.
130
131        Returns
132        -------
133        pandas.Series
134            Series of dataset names to exclude.
135        """
136        high_freq = 524
137        low_freq = 262
138
139        tgt = self.info['SAMPLING_RATE[kHz]']
140        mask = ~(
141            ((tgt >= low_freq - 5) & (tgt <= low_freq + 5)) |
142            ((tgt >= high_freq - 5) & (tgt <= high_freq + 5))
143        )
144        
145        df = self.info[mask]['dataset_name']
146        return df
147    
148
149    def filtering_imgs(self, path: str, name_pattern: str):
150        """
151        Filters out image paths (in self.img_path,self.names) corresponding to mixed-frequency datasets.
152
153        Parameters
154        ----------
155        path : str
156            Directory containing images.
157        name_pattern : str
158            Regular expression to extract dataset names from filenames.
159        """
160        mixed_freq = self.find_mixed_freq()
161        
162        for p in self.img_path:
163            dataset_name = re.search(name_pattern, p).group(0)
164            if dataset_name in mixed_freq.values:
165                self.names.remove(dataset_name+'.png')
166                self.img_path.remove(path+dataset_name+'.png')
167
168    def features(self):
169        """
170        Extracts deep features from all images using ResNet50 model.
171
172        Returns
173        -------
174        np.ndarray
175            Array of feature vectors for all valid images.
176        """
177        model, transform = self.model
178        model.eval()
179        features = []
180        for path in tqdm(self.img_path, desc='Extracting features'):
181            try:
182                with Image.open(path).convert('RGB') as img:
183                    img_tensor = transform(img).unsqueeze(0).to(self._device)
184                with torch.no_grad():
185                    feat = model(img_tensor).squeeze().cpu().numpy()
186                features.append(feat)
187            except OSError as err:
188                print(f'Error while openning an image {path}: {err}')
189        return np.array(features)
190    
191    
192    def create_database(self):
193        """
194        Extracts features, merges them with metadata, and constructs a full DataFrame.
195
196        Returns
197        -------
198        pandas.DataFrame
199            Feature database with metadata.
200        """
201        features = self.features()
202        try:
203            df_features = pd.DataFrame(
204                features,
205                columns=[f'feat_{i}' for i in range(features.shape[1])]
206            )
207
208            self.names = [name[:-4] for name in self.names]
209            df_features.insert(0, 'oldpath', self.img_path)
210            df_features.insert(0, 'dataset_name', self.names)
211            
212            
213            df_full = pd.merge(
214                self.info[['dataset_name', 'date', 'dist_to_sun[au]', 'SAMPLES_NUMBER', 'SAMPLING_RATE[kHz]', 'SAMPLE_LENGTH[ms]']], 
215                df_features, 
216                how='left', on='dataset_name')
217            df_full.dropna(inplace=True, ignore_index=True)
218            print('Database with information about observation parameters and extracted features:')
219            print(df_full.info())
220            print(df_full.head())
221            return df_full
222        except Exception as err:
223            print(f'Error during the feature extraction or database creation: {err}')
224        
225        
226
227    def filtering_nonzerocolumns(self):
228        """
229        Removes columns in the feature matrix that contain only zeros.
230
231        Returns
232        -------
233        pandas.DataFrame
234            Filtered DataFrame with non-zero feature columns.
235        """
236        df_features, excluded_part = ServiceFuncs.split_into_two(self.database)
237        non_zero_columns = ~(df_features == 0).all(axis=0)
238        filtered_features = df_features.loc[:, non_zero_columns]
239        final_df = pd.concat([excluded_part, filtered_features], axis=1)
240        print('Filtration of zero columns. Remaining size:')
241        print(final_df.shape[1])
242        return final_df
243    
244    def filtering_by_variance(self, threshold=5e-5):
245        """
246        Removes low-variance features from the database.
247
248        Parameters
249        ----------
250        threshold : float
251            Minimum variance required for a feature to be retained.
252
253        Returns
254        -------
255        pandas.DataFrame
256            Filtered DataFrame with high-variance features.
257        """
258        df_features, excluded_part = ServiceFuncs.split_into_two(self.database)
259        selector = VarianceThreshold(threshold=threshold)
260        filtered_features = selector.fit_transform(df_features)
261        df_filtered = pd.DataFrame(
262            filtered_features,
263            columns=[f'feat_{i}' for i in range(filtered_features.shape[1])]
264        )
265        print('Filtration by the variance threshold. Remaining size:')
266        final_df = pd.concat([excluded_part, df_filtered], axis=1)
267        print(final_df.shape[1])
268        return final_df
269    
270    def info_on_features(self, visualize=False, title=''):
271        """
272        Prints statistics on extracted features and optionally visualizes variance distribution.
273
274        Parameters
275        ----------
276        visualize : bool
277            If True, show a histogram of feature variances.
278        title : str
279            Optional title for the plot.
280        """
281        df_features, _ = ServiceFuncs.split_into_two(self.database)
282
283        distances = pairwise_distances(df_features, metric='cosine')
284        mean_dist = distances[np.triu_indices_from(distances, k=1)].mean()
285
286        print('Average cosine distance between embeddings:', mean_dist)
287        variances = np.var(df_features, axis=0)
288        print(f'Average variance: {np.mean(variances)}')
289
290        if visualize:
291            plt.figure(figsize=(7,5))
292            plt.subplot(1, 2, 1)
293            plt.hist(variances, bins=50, color='skyblue')
294            plt.ylabel('Frequency')
295            if title:
296                plt.title(title)
297            else:
298                plt.title('Variance')

Attributes
  • path (str): Path to the folder containing image files.
  • info_path (str): Path to the metadata text file with observation parameters.
  • flag (str): Mode of operation: 'read' to load precomputed database, 'extract' to generate it from images.
  • device (str): Computation device to use ('cuda' or 'cpu').
  • filter_mixed (bool): Whether to filter out mixed-frequency datasets.
  • name_pattern (str): Regex pattern to extract dataset names from image filenames.
  • extra_params (dict): Additional parameters for database loading/saving.

def filtering_imgs(self, path: str, name_pattern: str): 
150    def filtering_imgs(self, path: str, name_pattern: str):
151        """
152        Filters out image paths (in self.img_path,self.names) corresponding to mixed-frequency datasets.
153
154        Parameters
155        ----------
156        path : str
157            Directory containing images.
158        name_pattern : str
159            Regular expression to extract dataset names from filenames.
160        """
161        mixed_freq = self.find_mixed_freq()
162        
163        for p in self.img_path:
164            dataset_name = re.search(name_pattern, p).group(0)
165            if dataset_name in mixed_freq.values:
166                self.names.remove(dataset_name+'.png')
167                self.img_path.remove(path+dataset_name+'.png')

Filters out image paths (in self.img_path,self.names) corresponding to mixed-frequency datasets.

def features(self): 
169    def features(self):
170        """
171        Extracts deep features from all images using ResNet50 model.
172
173        Returns
174        -------
175        np.ndarray
176            Array of feature vectors for all valid images.
177        """
178        model, transform = self.model
179        model.eval()
180        features = []
181        for path in tqdm(self.img_path, desc='Extracting features'):
182            try:
183                with Image.open(path).convert('RGB') as img:
184                    img_tensor = transform(img).unsqueeze(0).to(self._device)
185                with torch.no_grad():
186                    feat = model(img_tensor).squeeze().cpu().numpy()
187                features.append(feat)
188            except OSError as err:
189                print(f'Error while openning an image {path}: {err}')
190        return np.array(features)

Extracts deep features from all images using ResNet50 model.

Returns
  • np.ndarray: Array of feature vectors for all valid images.

def info_on_features(self, visualize=False, title=''): 
271    def info_on_features(self, visualize=False, title=''):
272        """
273        Prints statistics on extracted features and optionally visualizes variance distribution.
274
275        Parameters
276        ----------
277        visualize : bool
278            If True, show a histogram of feature variances.
279        title : str
280            Optional title for the plot.
281        """
282        df_features, _ = ServiceFuncs.split_into_two(self.database)
283
284        distances = pairwise_distances(df_features, metric='cosine')
285        mean_dist = distances[np.triu_indices_from(distances, k=1)].mean()
286
287        print('Average cosine distance between embeddings:', mean_dist)
288        variances = np.var(df_features, axis=0)
289        print(f'Average variance: {np.mean(variances)}')
290
291        if visualize:
292            plt.figure(figsize=(7,5))
293            plt.subplot(1, 2, 1)
294            plt.hist(variances, bins=50, color='skyblue')
295            plt.ylabel('Frequency')
296            if title:
297                plt.title(title)
298            else:
299                plt.title('Variance')

 10from sklearn.decomposition import PCA
 11from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
 12from sklearn.pipeline import Pipeline
 13import umap
 14import pandas as pd
 15from libservice import ServiceFuncs
 16
 17
 18class FeaturesPreprocessing:
 19
 20    
 21    """
 22        Applies dimensionality reduction and scaling pipelines to a DataFrame of features.
 23
 24        This class provides a flexible wrapper around common preprocessing techniques 
 25        such as PCA, StandardScaler, and UMAP. The sequence of transformations is defined 
 26        by a string-based pipeline syntax.
 27
 28        Parameters
 29        ----------
 30        df : pandas.DataFrame
 31            Input DataFrame containing both metadata and features.
 32        copy : bool, optional
 33            If True, the input DataFrame is copied before processing.
 34            If False (default), the original DataFrame is modified in-place.
 35
 36        Attributes
 37        ----------
 38        models : dict
 39            Dictionary mapping method names ('pca', 'scaler', 'umapnd', 'umap2d') to
 40            their corresponding scikit-learn or UMAP objects.
 41        df : pandas.DataFrame
 42            Stored copy or reference to the input DataFrame.
 43    """
 44
 45
 46    def __init__(self, df, copy=False):
 47
 48        self.models = {
 49            'pca': PCA(n_components=0.95, svd_solver='full'),
 50            'scaler': StandardScaler(),
 51            'umapnd': umap.UMAP(n_components=20, min_dist=0.1, metric='cosine'),
 52            'umap2d': umap.UMAP(n_components=2, min_dist=0.1, metric='cosine')
 53        }
 54        if copy:
 55            self.df = df.copy()
 56        else:
 57            self.df = df
 58
 59    def preproccessing(self, df, pipe_str): #pipe_str='PCA+UMAP+..'
 60        """
 61        Applies a sequence of preprocessing transformations to the feature data.
 62
 63        Parameters
 64        ----------
 65        df : pandas.DataFrame
 66            Feature matrix (excluding metadata).
 67        pipe_str : str
 68            A string representing the sequence of transformations to apply,
 69            joined by '+'. For example: 'pca+umap2d'.
 70
 71        Returns
 72        -------
 73        numpy.ndarray or None
 74            Transformed feature array if input is non-empty; otherwise None.
 75
 76        Raises
 77        ------
 78        KeyError
 79            If the pipeline string contains unknown model names.
 80        """
 81        
 82        models = pipe_str.lower().split('+')
 83        pipes = []
 84        for m in models:
 85            pipes.append((m, self.models[m]))
 86        if df.size:
 87            pipe = Pipeline(pipes)
 88            results = pipe.fit_transform(df)
 89            return results
 90        else:
 91            return None
 92        
 93    def wrapper_preprop(self, df, pipe_str):
 94
 95        """
 96        Applies preprocessing to the feature part of a DataFrame while preserving metadata.
 97
 98        This method splits the input DataFrame into metadata and feature parts,
 99        applies the specified transformation pipeline to the features, and then
100        merges the result back with the metadata.
101
102        Parameters
103        ----------
104        df : pandas.DataFrame
105            Full input DataFrame including metadata and features.
106        pipe_str : str
107            Pipeline string specifying preprocessing steps (e.g., 'scaler+pca+umap2d').
108
109        Returns
110        -------
111        pandas.DataFrame
112            New DataFrame containing preserved metadata and transformed features.
113
114        Raises
115        ------
116        ValueError
117            If feature transformation fails or input DataFrame is empty.
118        """
119
120        df_features, excluded_part = ServiceFuncs.split_into_two(df)
121        processed = self.preproccessing(df_features, pipe_str)
122        df_processed = pd.DataFrame(
123            processed,
124            columns=[f'feat_{i}' for i in range(processed.shape[1])]
125        )
126        df_new = pd.concat([excluded_part, df_processed], axis=1)
127        return df_new

 11import subprocess

 13import hdbscan

 15from libservice import ServiceFuncs
 16from libpreprocessing import FeaturesPreprocessing
 17import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
 18import matplotlib
 19matplotlib.use('qtagg')
 20from matplotlib import rc

 22rc('text', usetex=True)

 24rc('text.latex', preamble=r"\usepackage[utf8]{inputenc}")

 28class Clustering:
 29
 30    """
 31    Performs HDBSCAN clustering on a feature dataset and manages file sorting and visualization.
 32
 33    This class supports unsupervised clustering using the HDBSCAN algorithm,
 34    updates the associated feature database with labels, and organizes files
 35    into directories based on cluster assignments. It also includes tools for
 36    cluster visualization using PCA and UMAP.
 37
 38    Parameters
 39    ----------
 40    df : pandas.DataFrame
 41        Input feature DataFrame containing at least 'oldpath' and feature columns.
 42    copy : bool, optional
 43        If True, the input DataFrame is copied internally. Default is False.
 44    clear : bool, optional
 45        If True, the target directory './processed' will be cleared before use. Default is True.
 46
 47    Attributes
 48    ----------
 49    df : pandas.DataFrame
 50        The working DataFrame, either copied or referenced.
 51    num_clusters : int
 52        Number of clusters found (excluding noise).
 53    labels : list of int
 54        Cluster labels assigned by HDBSCAN (-1 indicates noise).
 55    dir : str
 56        Directory path where clustered files will be organized (default is './processed').
 57    """
 58
 59    def __init__(self, df, copy=False, clear=True):
 60
 61        if copy:
 62            self.df = df.copy()
 63        else:
 64            self.df = df
 65        self.num_clusters = 0
 66        self.labels = []
 67        self.dir = './processed'
 68        ServiceFuncs.preparing_folder(self.dir, clear=clear)
 69
 70
 71    def clustering_HDBSCAN(self, df):
 72        """
 73        Applies HDBSCAN clustering to the given feature matrix.
 74
 75        Parameters
 76        ----------
 77        df : pandas.DataFrame or numpy.ndarray
 78            Feature matrix with shape (n_samples, n_features).
 79
 80        Returns
 81        -------
 82        labels : numpy.ndarray
 83            Array of cluster labels for each sample (-1 indicates noise).
 84        num_clusters : int
 85            Number of clusters detected (excluding noise).
 86        """
 87        
 88        clusterer = hdbscan.HDBSCAN(min_cluster_size=15, min_samples=5, metric='euclidean')
 89        self.labels = clusterer.fit_predict(df)
 90        self.num_clusters = len(set(self.labels)) - (1 if -1 in self.labels else 0)
 91        return self.labels, self.num_clusters
 92    
 93    def update_database(self):
 94        """
 95        Inserts the cluster labels into the internal DataFrame as a new column 'label'.
 96        """
 97
 98        self.df.insert(1, 'label', self.labels)
 99        self.df.head()
100
101    def create_dirs(self):
102        """
103        Creates output directories for each cluster and a separate one for noise.
104        The directories are created under `self.dir` if they do not already exist.
105        """
106        if os.path.exists(self.dir):
107            for cl in range(self.num_clusters):
108                dir_name = self.dir+'/label_'+str(cl)
109                if not os.path.exists(dir_name):
110                    os.makedirs(dir_name)
111            if not os.path.exists(self.dir+'/noise'):
112                os.makedirs(self.dir+'/noise')
113
114
115    def create_newpath(self):
116        """
117        Assigns new output paths for each sample in the DataFrame based on their cluster label.
118        Clustered samples go to './processed/label_<cluster>', noise samples go to './processed/noise'.
119        """
120         
121        for cl in range(self.num_clusters):
122            self.df.loc[self.df['label'] == cl, 'path'] = './processed/label_'+str(cl)
123        self.df.loc[self.df['label'] == -1, 'path'] = './processed/noise'
124
125
126    def copy_files(self):
127        """
128        Copies image files from their original locations ('oldpath') to the new cluster-assigned directories ('path').
129
130        Skips rows where either path is missing or not a string. Errors are printed but do not interrupt execution.
131        """
132
133        for index, row in self.df.iterrows():
134            oldpath = row['oldpath']
135            newpath = row['path']
136            if isinstance(oldpath, str) and isinstance(newpath, str):
137                try:
138                    subprocess.run(['cp', '-u', row['oldpath'], row['path']], check=True)
139                except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:
140                    print(f'Error during copying {row['oldpath']} → {row['path']}: {e}')
141            else:
142                print(f'Probably missing path {index}: oldpath={oldpath}, path={newpath}')
143        
144    def sort_files(self):
145        """
146        Organizes image files into directories by cluster.
147
148        This method:
149        - Creates cluster directories
150        - Assigns new file paths
151        - Copies files to new locations
152        - Removes the 'oldpath' column from the DataFrame
153        """
154
155        self.create_dirs()
156        self.create_newpath()
157        self.copy_files()
158        self.df.drop('oldpath', axis=1, inplace=True)
159
160
161    def visualize_HDBSCAN(self, df):
162        """
163        Reduces the feature space to 2D using PCA + UMAP, applies HDBSCAN clustering, and plots the results.
164
165        Parameters
166        ----------
167        df : pandas.DataFrame
168            Input DataFrame containing features and metadata.
169
170        Saves
171        -----
172        './figures/clusterization_triggered.pdf' : PDF version of the cluster plot
173        './figures/clusterization_triggered.png' : PNG version (300 DPI)
174
175        Shows
176        -----
177        A scatter plot of the clustered data with noise in gray and clusters in color.
178        """
179        
180        df_features, _= ServiceFuncs.split_into_two(df)
181        features_processed = FeaturesPreprocessing(df, copy=True).preproccessing(df_features, 'PCA+UMAP2D')
182        labels, n_clusters = self.clustering_HDBSCAN(features_processed)
183        print(f'Found {n_clusters} clusters (2D)')
184        plt.figure(figsize=(10, 8))
185        palette = plt.get_cmap('tab10')
186
187        for label in set(labels):
188            mask = labels == label
189            color = 'gray' if label == -1 else palette(label % 10)
190            plt.scatter(features_processed[mask, 0], features_processed[mask, 1], s=10, color=color, label=f'Cluster {label}' if label != -1 else 'Noise')
191
192        plt.legend()
193        plt.title('PCA + UMAP2D + HDBSCAN: clustering visualization')
194        plt.xlabel('UMAP-1 component')
195        plt.ylabel('UMAP-2  component')
196        
197        if not os.path.exists('./figures'):
198            os.makedirs('./figures')
199
200        plt.savefig('./figures/clusterization_triggered.pdf', format='pdf')
201        plt.savefig('./figures/clusterization_triggered.png', format='png', dpi=300)
202
203        plt.show()
class Clustering: 
 29class Clustering:
 30
 31    """
 32    Performs HDBSCAN clustering on a feature dataset and manages file sorting and visualization.
 33
 34    This class supports unsupervised clustering using the HDBSCAN algorithm,
 35    updates the associated feature database with labels, and organizes files
 36    into directories based on cluster assignments. It also includes tools for
 37    cluster visualization using PCA and UMAP.
 38
 39    Parameters
 40    ----------
 41    df : pandas.DataFrame
 42        Input feature DataFrame containing at least 'oldpath' and feature columns.
 43    copy : bool, optional
 44        If True, the input DataFrame is copied internally. Default is False.
 45    clear : bool, optional
 46        If True, the target directory './processed' will be cleared before use. Default is True.
 47
 48    Attributes
 49    ----------
 50    df : pandas.DataFrame
 51        The working DataFrame, either copied or referenced.
 52    num_clusters : int
 53        Number of clusters found (excluding noise).
 54    labels : list of int
 55        Cluster labels assigned by HDBSCAN (-1 indicates noise).
 56    dir : str
 57        Directory path where clustered files will be organized (default is './processed').
 58    """
 59
 60    def __init__(self, df, copy=False, clear=True):
 61
 62        if copy:
 63            self.df = df.copy()
 64        else:
 65            self.df = df
 66        self.num_clusters = 0
 67        self.labels = []
 68        self.dir = './processed'
 69        ServiceFuncs.preparing_folder(self.dir, clear=clear)
 70
 71
 72    def clustering_HDBSCAN(self, df):
 73        """
 74        Applies HDBSCAN clustering to the given feature matrix.
 75
 76        Parameters
 77        ----------
 78        df : pandas.DataFrame or numpy.ndarray
 79            Feature matrix with shape (n_samples, n_features).
 80
 81        Returns
 82        -------
 83        labels : numpy.ndarray
 84            Array of cluster labels for each sample (-1 indicates noise).
 85        num_clusters : int
 86            Number of clusters detected (excluding noise).
 87        """
 88        
 89        clusterer = hdbscan.HDBSCAN(min_cluster_size=15, min_samples=5, metric='euclidean')
 90        self.labels = clusterer.fit_predict(df)
 91        self.num_clusters = len(set(self.labels)) - (1 if -1 in self.labels else 0)
 92        return self.labels, self.num_clusters
 93    
 94    def update_database(self):
 95        """
 96        Inserts the cluster labels into the internal DataFrame as a new column 'label'.
 97        """
 98
 99        self.df.insert(1, 'label', self.labels)
100        self.df.head()
101
102    def create_dirs(self):
103        """
104        Creates output directories for each cluster and a separate one for noise.
105        The directories are created under `self.dir` if they do not already exist.
106        """
107        if os.path.exists(self.dir):
108            for cl in range(self.num_clusters):
109                dir_name = self.dir+'/label_'+str(cl)
110                if not os.path.exists(dir_name):
111                    os.makedirs(dir_name)
112            if not os.path.exists(self.dir+'/noise'):
113                os.makedirs(self.dir+'/noise')
114
115
116    def create_newpath(self):
117        """
118        Assigns new output paths for each sample in the DataFrame based on their cluster label.
119        Clustered samples go to './processed/label_<cluster>', noise samples go to './processed/noise'.
120        """
121         
122        for cl in range(self.num_clusters):
123            self.df.loc[self.df['label'] == cl, 'path'] = './processed/label_'+str(cl)
124        self.df.loc[self.df['label'] == -1, 'path'] = './processed/noise'
125
126
127    def copy_files(self):
128        """
129        Copies image files from their original locations ('oldpath') to the new cluster-assigned directories ('path').
130
131        Skips rows where either path is missing or not a string. Errors are printed but do not interrupt execution.
132        """
133
134        for index, row in self.df.iterrows():
135            oldpath = row['oldpath']
136            newpath = row['path']
137            if isinstance(oldpath, str) and isinstance(newpath, str):
138                try:
139                    subprocess.run(['cp', '-u', row['oldpath'], row['path']], check=True)
140                except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:
141                    print(f'Error during copying {row['oldpath']} → {row['path']}: {e}')
142            else:
143                print(f'Probably missing path {index}: oldpath={oldpath}, path={newpath}')
144        
145    def sort_files(self):
146        """
147        Organizes image files into directories by cluster.
148
149        This method:
150        - Creates cluster directories
151        - Assigns new file paths
152        - Copies files to new locations
153        - Removes the 'oldpath' column from the DataFrame
154        """
155
156        self.create_dirs()
157        self.create_newpath()
158        self.copy_files()
159        self.df.drop('oldpath', axis=1, inplace=True)
160
161
162    def visualize_HDBSCAN(self, df):
163        """
164        Reduces the feature space to 2D using PCA + UMAP, applies HDBSCAN clustering, and plots the results.
165
166        Parameters
167        ----------
168        df : pandas.DataFrame
169            Input DataFrame containing features and metadata.
170
171        Saves
172        -----
173        './figures/clusterization_triggered.pdf' : PDF version of the cluster plot
174        './figures/clusterization_triggered.png' : PNG version (300 DPI)
175
176        Shows
177        -----
178        A scatter plot of the clustered data with noise in gray and clusters in color.
179        """
180        
181        df_features, _= ServiceFuncs.split_into_two(df)
182        features_processed = FeaturesPreprocessing(df, copy=True).preproccessing(df_features, 'PCA+UMAP2D')
183        labels, n_clusters = self.clustering_HDBSCAN(features_processed)
184        print(f'Found {n_clusters} clusters (2D)')
185        plt.figure(figsize=(10, 8))
186        palette = plt.get_cmap('tab10')
187
188        for label in set(labels):
189            mask = labels == label
190            color = 'gray' if label == -1 else palette(label % 10)
191            plt.scatter(features_processed[mask, 0], features_processed[mask, 1], s=10, color=color, label=f'Cluster {label}' if label != -1 else 'Noise')
192
193        plt.legend()
194        plt.title('PCA + UMAP2D + HDBSCAN: clustering visualization')
195        plt.xlabel('UMAP-1 component')
196        plt.ylabel('UMAP-2  component')
197        
198        if not os.path.exists('./figures'):
199            os.makedirs('./figures')
200
201        plt.savefig('./figures/clusterization_triggered.pdf', format='pdf')
202        plt.savefig('./figures/clusterization_triggered.png', format='png', dpi=300)
203
204        plt.show()

Performs HDBSCAN clustering on a feature dataset and manages file sorting and visualization.

This class supports unsupervised clustering using the HDBSCAN algorithm, updates the associated feature database with labels, and organizes files into directories based on cluster assignments. It also includes tools for cluster visualization using PCA and UMAP.

Parameters
  • df (pandas.DataFrame): Input feature DataFrame containing at least 'oldpath' and feature columns.
  • copy (bool, optional): If True, the input DataFrame is copied internally. Default is False.
  • clear (bool, optional): If True, the target directory './processed' will be cleared before use. Default is True.
Attributes
  • df (pandas.DataFrame): The working DataFrame, either copied or referenced.
  • num_clusters (int): Number of clusters found (excluding noise).
  • labels (list of int): Cluster labels assigned by HDBSCAN (-1 indicates noise).
  • dir (str): Directory path where clustered files will be organized (default is './processed').

  9from libpreprocessing import FeaturesPreprocessing
 10from libclustering import Clustering

 13
 14class InteractiveMode:
 15
 16    """
 17    Provides a user-friendly interactive interface to the full pipeline of feature extraction,
 18    preprocessing, clustering, and result saving.
 19
 20    This class serves as a high-level command-line wrapper around the functionality defined
 21    in modules like `libfeatures`, `libpreprocessing`, and `libclustering`. It guides the
 22    user through a series of prompts to configure and execute data processing operations.
 23
 24    This class is not intended to be instantiated.
 25    """
 26
 27    def __init__(self):
 28        raise RuntimeError('This class can not be instantiate.')
 29    
 30    @staticmethod
 31    def welcome_message():
 32        """
 33        Prints a welcome message with initial instructions for placing image data.
 34        """
 35
 36        message = 'Welcome to the script! \n' + \
 37        'First place your images in a separate folder (into "./images/") named according to the template: \n \
 38        "images_(your_specification)"'
 39        print(message)
 40
 41    @staticmethod
 42    def preparations():
 43        """
 44        Prepares required working directories and gathers the user’s image folder name.
 45
 46        Returns
 47        -------
 48        input_imags : str
 49            Name of the user-specified image subdirectory.
 50        default_filename : str
 51            Suggested default filename for saving feature data.
 52        """
 53
 54        base_dir_names = ['./images', './processed', './figures', './data', './results']
 55        message = 'Use "./processed" folder for processed images \n' + \
 56        '"./data" folder for info metadata \n' + \
 57        '"./figures" and "./results" for graphic and data results, respectively.'
 58        print(message)
 59
 60        for dirname in base_dir_names:
 61            ServiceFuncs.preparing_folder(dirname, clear=False)
 62
 63        input_imags = input('Please enter the name of your working directory: ').strip('./, ')
 64        specification = ServiceFuncs.input_name(input_imags)
 65        results_dir = './processed/processed_'+specification
 66        default_filename = './results/pearson_diagram_data_'+specification
 67
 68        clear = InteractiveMode.get_bool(f'If folder {results_dir} already exists would you like to clear its contents? (True or False) ')
 69        ServiceFuncs.preparing_folder(results_dir, clear=clear)
 70
 71        return input_imags, default_filename
 72
 73    @staticmethod
 74    def get_bool(prompt: str)-> bool: 
 75        """
 76        Prompts the user for a True/False response.
 77
 78        Parameters
 79        ----------
 80        prompt : str
 81            Prompt text for user input.
 82
 83        Returns
 84        -------
 85        bool
 86            Boolean interpretation of the user's input.
 87
 88        Raises
 89        ------
 90        KeyError
 91            If input is not 'true' or 'false' (case-insensitive).
 92        """
 93        while True:
 94            
 95                answ = input(prompt).lower()
 96                if answ:
 97                    try:
 98                        return {'true': True, 'false': False}[answ]
 99                    except KeyError as e:
100                        print(f'Invalid input, please enter True or False! {e}')
101                else:
102                    return True
103            
104
105    @staticmethod
106    def filter_mixed_freq(name_pattern):
107        """
108        Asks the user whether to filter out mixed-frequency data.
109
110        Parameters
111        ----------
112        name_pattern : str
113            Default regular expression used to match dataset names.
114
115        Returns
116        -------
117        filter_mixed : bool
118            Whether to apply frequency filtering.
119        name_pattern : str
120            Possibly updated regex pattern provided by the user.
121        """
122
123        filter_mixed = InteractiveMode.get_bool('Would you like to filter mixed frequencies? (True or False) ')
124        if filter_mixed:
125            print(f'Check the name pattern: {name_pattern}')
126            np_input = input('Change if it is needed or press "Enter": ').strip()
127            if np_input:
128                name_pattern = np_input
129        return filter_mixed, name_pattern
130    
131    @staticmethod
132    def get_path(message, default_path):
133        """
134        Gets a file path from the user, or uses the default if none is entered.
135
136        Parameters
137        ----------
138        message : str
139            Prompt for the user.
140        default_path : str
141            Default path to return if user provides no input.
142
143        Returns
144        -------
145        str
146            Final path.
147        """
148
149        file_path = input(message)
150        file_path = file_path if file_path else default_path
151        return file_path
152    
153    @staticmethod
154    def get_features(input_imags, info_path, default_filename, name_pattern):
155        """
156        Asks the user whether to extract new features or read from file.
157
158        Parameters
159        ----------
160        input_imags : str
161            Subdirectory name with image data.
162        info_path : str
163            Path to the metadata file.
164        default_filename : str
165            Default base filename for feature data.
166        name_pattern : str
167            Regex pattern for identifying dataset names.
168
169        Returns
170        -------
171        ResNetFeatures
172            An instance of the ResNetFeatures class containing the loaded/extracted features.
173        """
174        message = f'To extract features from images located in {input_imags} enter 1. \n' + \
175                'To load features from a file enter 2.'
176        print(message)
177
178        while True:
179            try:
180                choice = int(input('[1/2]: ').strip())
181            except ValueError:
182                print("Invalid input. Please enter 1 or 2.")
183                continue
184
185            if choice == 1:
186                features = InteractiveMode.extract_features(input_imags, info_path, default_filename, name_pattern)
187                break
188
189            elif choice == 2:
190                
191                features = InteractiveMode.read_features(input_imags, info_path, default_filename, name_pattern)
192                break
193            else:
194                print('Invalid input. \n Try again!')
195        return features
196    
197    @staticmethod
198    def extract_features(input_imags, info_path, default_filename, name_pattern):
199        """
200        Initializes feature extraction and saves them to file.
201
202        Parameters
203        ----------
204        input_imags : str
205            Folder containing images.
206        info_path : str
207            Path to the metadata file.
208        default_filename : str
209            Default file path for saving results.
210        name_pattern : str
211            Regex pattern for dataset name recognition.
212
213        Returns
214        -------
215        ResNetFeatures
216            Object containing the extracted feature database.
217        """
218        message = f'Enter a file name to write extracted features (or press "Enter" for default "{default_filename}"): '
219        file_to_write = InteractiveMode.get_path(message, default_filename)
220        filter_mixed, name_pattern = InteractiveMode.filter_mixed_freq(name_pattern)
221
222        print('Features extraction')
223        features = ResNetFeatures(
224            path='./images/' + input_imags + '/',
225            flag='extract',
226            info_path=info_path,
227            filter_mixed=filter_mixed,
228            name_pattern=name_pattern,
229            extra_params={'file_to_write': file_to_write}
230        )
231        return features
232    
233    @staticmethod
234    def read_features(input_imags, info_path, default_filename, name_pattern):
235        """
236        Loads previously saved feature data from a file.
237
238        Parameters
239        ----------
240        input_imags : str
241            Folder containing images.
242        info_path : str
243            Path to the metadata file.
244        default_filename : str
245            Default file path for loading.
246        name_pattern : str
247            Regex pattern for dataset name recognition.
248
249        Returns
250        -------
251        ResNetFeatures
252            Object containing the loaded feature database.
253        """
254
255        message = f'Enter a file name to read from (or press "Enter" for default "{default_filename}"): '
256        file_to_read = InteractiveMode.get_path(message, default_filename)
257        filter_mixed, name_pattern = InteractiveMode.filter_mixed_freq(name_pattern)
258
259        print('Loading features')
260        features = ResNetFeatures(
261            path='./images/' + input_imags + '/',
262            flag='read',
263            info_path=info_path,
264            filter_mixed=filter_mixed,
265            name_pattern=name_pattern,
266            extra_params={'file_to_read': file_to_read}
267        )
268        return features
269    
270    @staticmethod
271    def run_processing(features, default_filename):
272        """
273        Offers the user a choice between standard pipeline execution or custom steps.
274
275        Parameters
276        ----------
277        features : ResNetFeatures
278            Feature database.
279        default_filename : str
280            Base name for saving intermediate or final results.
281        """
282        message = 'Would you like to launch the standard processing algorithm (1) or \n' + \
283                    'to call separate blocks of processing manually (2)?'
284        print(message)
285        while True:
286            num=input('Enter 1 or 2 (or break to stop): ')
287            if num == 'break':
288                break
289            else:
290                if int(num) == 1:
291                    InteractiveMode.standard_algorithm(features, default_filename)
292                elif int(num) == 2:
293                    print('This part has not been implemented yet. Use 1 or break.')
294
295
296
297    @staticmethod
298    def standard_algorithm(features, default_filename):
299        """
300        Executes the full default processing pipeline:
301        1. Feature filtering by variance
302        2. Dimensionality reduction with PCA and UMAP
303        3. Clustering with HDBSCAN
304        4. Visualization
305
306        Parameters
307        ----------
308        features : ResNetFeatures
309            Input feature database object.
310        default_filename : str
311            Base filename for saving outputs.
312        """
313        message = 'The standard algorithm: \n' + \
314            '1. Filtration of ResNet features by variance, thershold=1e-5 \n' + \
315            '2. Preprocessing of the filtered features with \n' + \
316            '   - PCA(n_components=0.95, svd_solver=\'full\') \n' + \
317            '   - UMAP(n_components=20, min_dist=0.1, metric=\'cosine\') \n' + \
318            '3. Clusterization \n' + \
319            '- HDBSCAN(min_cluster_size=15, min_samples=5, metric=\'euclidean\') \n' + \
320            '4. Visualization with PCA+UMAP2D+HDBSCAN'
321        print(message)
322        
323        features = InteractiveMode.filtration(features)
324
325        message = f'Enter a file name to save the filtered data (or press "Enter" to use default name): '
326        InteractiveMode.saving_database(features.database, default_filename, message, suf='_filtered')
327
328        processed = InteractiveMode.run_preprocessing(features, 'PCA+UMAPND')
329
330        clusters = InteractiveMode.run_clusterization(processed)
331
332        message = 'Enter a file name to save the clustered data (or press "Enter" to use default name): '
333        InteractiveMode.saving_database(clusters.df, default_filename, message, suf='_clustered')
334
335        # Visualization
336        clusters.visualize_HDBSCAN(features.database)
337
338    @staticmethod
339    def filtration(features):
340        """
341        Applies variance-based filtering to the feature set.
342
343        Parameters
344        ----------
345        features : ResNetFeatures
346            Input feature database.
347
348        Returns
349        -------
350        ResNetFeatures
351            Filtered features with updated `.database`.
352        """
353        print('Filtration')
354        features.database = features.filtering_by_variance()
355        features.info_on_features()
356        return features
357    
358    @staticmethod
359    def create_name_to_save(default_filename, file_to_write=None, suffix=None):
360        """
361        Constructs a filename by combining a base name with a suffix.
362
363        Parameters
364        ----------
365        default_filename : str
366            Base filename.
367        file_to_write : str, optional
368            Custom filename provided by the user.
369        suffix : str, optional
370            Suffix to append to the filename.
371
372        Returns
373        -------
374        str
375            Full filename with optional suffix.
376        """
377        if not file_to_write:
378            file_to_write = default_filename
379        if suffix:
380            file_to_write += suffix
381        return file_to_write
382    
383    @staticmethod
384    def saving_database(df, default_filename, message, suf):
385        """
386        Prompts the user to save the DataFrame to a file with optional suffix.
387
388        Parameters
389        ----------
390        df : pandas.DataFrame
391            Data to be saved.
392        default_filename : str
393            Default file base name.
394        message : str
395            Prompt shown to the user.
396        suf : str
397            Default suffix to append to the filename.
398        """
399        file_to_write = input(message)
400        suffix = input('or/and enter a suffix to the filename: ') or suf
401        file_to_write = InteractiveMode.create_name_to_save(default_filename, file_to_write=file_to_write, suffix=suffix)
402        ServiceFuncs.save_database(df, file_to_write=file_to_write)
403
404    @staticmethod
405    def run_preprocessing(features, pipe_str='PCA+UMAPND'):
406        """
407        Applies a sequence of dimensionality reduction steps to the feature matrix.
408
409        Parameters
410        ----------
411        features : ResNetFeatures
412            The extracted and optionally filtered features.
413        pipe_str : str, optional
414            Pipeline specification string, e.g., 'PCA+UMAPND'.
415
416        Returns
417        -------
418        pandas.DataFrame
419            Transformed feature DataFrame with original metadata preserved.
420        """
421        print('Preprocessing')
422        preprop = FeaturesPreprocessing(features)
423        processed = preprop.wrapper_preprop(features.database, pipe_str)
424        return processed
425    
426    @staticmethod
427    def run_clusterization(features):
428        """
429        Performs HDBSCAN clustering and sorts image files into corresponding folders.
430
431        Parameters
432        ----------
433        features : pandas.DataFrame
434            The feature matrix with metadata.
435
436        Returns
437        -------
438        Clustering
439            Clustering object with updated label assignments and organized folders.
440        """
441
442        print('Clusterization')
443        clusters = Clustering(features)
444        df_features, _ = ServiceFuncs.split_into_two(features)
445        _, num_clusters = clusters.clustering_HDBSCAN(df_features)
446        print(f'Number of clusters 20D: {num_clusters}')
447        clusters.update_database()
448        clusters.sort_files()
449        return clusters

class InteractiveMode: 
 15class InteractiveMode:
 16
 17    """
 18    Provides a user-friendly interactive interface to the full pipeline of feature extraction,
 19    preprocessing, clustering, and result saving.
 20
 21    This class serves as a high-level command-line wrapper around the functionality defined
 22    in modules like `libfeatures`, `libpreprocessing`, and `libclustering`. It guides the
 23    user through a series of prompts to configure and execute data processing operations.
 24
 25    This class is not intended to be instantiated.
 26    """
 27
 28    def __init__(self):
 29        raise RuntimeError('This class can not be instantiate.')
 30    
 31    @staticmethod
 32    def welcome_message():
 33        """
 34        Prints a welcome message with initial instructions for placing image data.
 35        """
 36
 37        message = 'Welcome to the script! \n' + \
 38        'First place your images in a separate folder (into "./images/") named according to the template: \n \
 39        "images_(your_specification)"'
 40        print(message)
 41
 42    @staticmethod
 43    def preparations():
 44        """
 45        Prepares required working directories and gathers the user’s image folder name.
 46
 47        Returns
 48        -------
 49        input_imags : str
 50            Name of the user-specified image subdirectory.
 51        default_filename : str
 52            Suggested default filename for saving feature data.
 53        """
 54
 55        base_dir_names = ['./images', './processed', './figures', './data', './results']
 56        message = 'Use "./processed" folder for processed images \n' + \
 57        '"./data" folder for info metadata \n' + \
 58        '"./figures" and "./results" for graphic and data results, respectively.'
 59        print(message)
 60
 61        for dirname in base_dir_names:
 62            ServiceFuncs.preparing_folder(dirname, clear=False)
 63
 64        input_imags = input('Please enter the name of your working directory: ').strip('./, ')
 65        specification = ServiceFuncs.input_name(input_imags)
 66        results_dir = './processed/processed_'+specification
 67        default_filename = './results/pearson_diagram_data_'+specification
 68
 69        clear = InteractiveMode.get_bool(f'If folder {results_dir} already exists would you like to clear its contents? (True or False) ')
 70        ServiceFuncs.preparing_folder(results_dir, clear=clear)
 71
 72        return input_imags, default_filename
 73
 74    @staticmethod
 75    def get_bool(prompt: str)-> bool: 
 76        """
 77        Prompts the user for a True/False response.
 78
 79        Parameters
 80        ----------
 81        prompt : str
 82            Prompt text for user input.
 83
 84        Returns
 85        -------
 86        bool
 87            Boolean interpretation of the user's input.
 88
 89        Raises
 90        ------
 91        KeyError
 92            If input is not 'true' or 'false' (case-insensitive).
 93        """
 94        while True:
 95            
 96                answ = input(prompt).lower()
 97                if answ:
 98                    try:
 99                        return {'true': True, 'false': False}[answ]
100                    except KeyError as e:
101                        print(f'Invalid input, please enter True or False! {e}')
102                else:
103                    return True
104            
105
106    @staticmethod
107    def filter_mixed_freq(name_pattern):
108        """
109        Asks the user whether to filter out mixed-frequency data.
110
111        Parameters
112        ----------
113        name_pattern : str
114            Default regular expression used to match dataset names.
115
116        Returns
117        -------
118        filter_mixed : bool
119            Whether to apply frequency filtering.
120        name_pattern : str
121            Possibly updated regex pattern provided by the user.
122        """
123
124        filter_mixed = InteractiveMode.get_bool('Would you like to filter mixed frequencies? (True or False) ')
125        if filter_mixed:
126            print(f'Check the name pattern: {name_pattern}')
127            np_input = input('Change if it is needed or press "Enter": ').strip()
128            if np_input:
129                name_pattern = np_input
130        return filter_mixed, name_pattern
131    
132    @staticmethod
133    def get_path(message, default_path):
134        """
135        Gets a file path from the user, or uses the default if none is entered.
136
137        Parameters
138        ----------
139        message : str
140            Prompt for the user.
141        default_path : str
142            Default path to return if user provides no input.
143
144        Returns
145        -------
146        str
147            Final path.
148        """
149
150        file_path = input(message)
151        file_path = file_path if file_path else default_path
152        return file_path
153    
154    @staticmethod
155    def get_features(input_imags, info_path, default_filename, name_pattern):
156        """
157        Asks the user whether to extract new features or read from file.
158
159        Parameters
160        ----------
161        input_imags : str
162            Subdirectory name with image data.
163        info_path : str
164            Path to the metadata file.
165        default_filename : str
166            Default base filename for feature data.
167        name_pattern : str
168            Regex pattern for identifying dataset names.
169
170        Returns
171        -------
172        ResNetFeatures
173            An instance of the ResNetFeatures class containing the loaded/extracted features.
174        """
175        message = f'To extract features from images located in {input_imags} enter 1. \n' + \
176                'To load features from a file enter 2.'
177        print(message)
178
179        while True:
180            try:
181                choice = int(input('[1/2]: ').strip())
182            except ValueError:
183                print("Invalid input. Please enter 1 or 2.")
184                continue
185
186            if choice == 1:
187                features = InteractiveMode.extract_features(input_imags, info_path, default_filename, name_pattern)
188                break
189
190            elif choice == 2:
191                
192                features = InteractiveMode.read_features(input_imags, info_path, default_filename, name_pattern)
193                break
194            else:
195                print('Invalid input. \n Try again!')
196        return features
197    
198    @staticmethod
199    def extract_features(input_imags, info_path, default_filename, name_pattern):
200        """
201        Initializes feature extraction and saves them to file.
202
203        Parameters
204        ----------
205        input_imags : str
206            Folder containing images.
207        info_path : str
208            Path to the metadata file.
209        default_filename : str
210            Default file path for saving results.
211        name_pattern : str
212            Regex pattern for dataset name recognition.
213
214        Returns
215        -------
216        ResNetFeatures
217            Object containing the extracted feature database.
218        """
219        message = f'Enter a file name to write extracted features (or press "Enter" for default "{default_filename}"): '
220        file_to_write = InteractiveMode.get_path(message, default_filename)
221        filter_mixed, name_pattern = InteractiveMode.filter_mixed_freq(name_pattern)
222
223        print('Features extraction')
224        features = ResNetFeatures(
225            path='./images/' + input_imags + '/',
226            flag='extract',
227            info_path=info_path,
228            filter_mixed=filter_mixed,
229            name_pattern=name_pattern,
230            extra_params={'file_to_write': file_to_write}
231        )
232        return features
233    
234    @staticmethod
235    def read_features(input_imags, info_path, default_filename, name_pattern):
236        """
237        Loads previously saved feature data from a file.
238
239        Parameters
240        ----------
241        input_imags : str
242            Folder containing images.
243        info_path : str
244            Path to the metadata file.
245        default_filename : str
246            Default file path for loading.
247        name_pattern : str
248            Regex pattern for dataset name recognition.
249
250        Returns
251        -------
252        ResNetFeatures
253            Object containing the loaded feature database.
254        """
255
256        message = f'Enter a file name to read from (or press "Enter" for default "{default_filename}"): '
257        file_to_read = InteractiveMode.get_path(message, default_filename)
258        filter_mixed, name_pattern = InteractiveMode.filter_mixed_freq(name_pattern)
259
260        print('Loading features')
261        features = ResNetFeatures(
262            path='./images/' + input_imags + '/',
263            flag='read',
264            info_path=info_path,
265            filter_mixed=filter_mixed,
266            name_pattern=name_pattern,
267            extra_params={'file_to_read': file_to_read}
268        )
269        return features
270    
271    @staticmethod
272    def run_processing(features, default_filename):
273        """
274        Offers the user a choice between standard pipeline execution or custom steps.
275
276        Parameters
277        ----------
278        features : ResNetFeatures
279            Feature database.
280        default_filename : str
281            Base name for saving intermediate or final results.
282        """
283        message = 'Would you like to launch the standard processing algorithm (1) or \n' + \
284                    'to call separate blocks of processing manually (2)?'
285        print(message)
286        while True:
287            num=input('Enter 1 or 2 (or break to stop): ')
288            if num == 'break':
289                break
290            else:
291                if int(num) == 1:
292                    InteractiveMode.standard_algorithm(features, default_filename)
293                elif int(num) == 2:
294                    print('This part has not been implemented yet. Use 1 or break.')
295

192                features = InteractiveMode.read_features(input_imags, info_path, default_filename, name_pattern)
193                break
194            else:
195                print('Invalid input. \n Try again!')
196        return features

@staticmethod
def run_processing(features, default_filename): 
271    @staticmethod
272    def run_processing(features, default_filename):
273        """
274        Offers the user a choice between standard pipeline execution or custom steps.
275
276        Parameters
277        ----------
278        features : ResNetFeatures
279            Feature database.
280        default_filename : str
281            Base name for saving intermediate or final results.
282        """
283        message = 'Would you like to launch the standard processing algorithm (1) or \n' + \
284                    'to call separate blocks of processing manually (2)?'
285        print(message)
286        while True:
287            num=input('Enter 1 or 2 (or break to stop): ')
288            if num == 'break':
289                break
290            else:
291                if int(num) == 1:
292                    InteractiveMode.standard_algorithm(features, default_filename)
293                elif int(num) == 2:
294                    print('This part has not been implemented yet. Use 1 or break.')

@staticmethod
def standard_algorithm(features, default_filename): 
298    @staticmethod
299    def standard_algorithm(features, default_filename):
300        """
301        Executes the full default processing pipeline:
302        1. Feature filtering by variance
303        2. Dimensionality reduction with PCA and UMAP
304        3. Clustering with HDBSCAN
305        4. Visualization
306
307        Parameters
308        ----------
309        features : ResNetFeatures
310            Input feature database object.
311        default_filename : str
312            Base filename for saving outputs.
313        """
314        message = 'The standard algorithm: \n' + \
315            '1. Filtration of ResNet features by variance, thershold=1e-5 \n' + \
316            '2. Preprocessing of the filtered features with \n' + \
317            '   - PCA(n_components=0.95, svd_solver=\'full\') \n' + \
318            '   - UMAP(n_components=20, min_dist=0.1, metric=\'cosine\') \n' + \
319            '3. Clusterization \n' + \
320            '- HDBSCAN(min_cluster_size=15, min_samples=5, metric=\'euclidean\') \n' + \
321            '4. Visualization with PCA+UMAP2D+HDBSCAN'
322        print(message)
323        
324        features = InteractiveMode.filtration(features)
325
326        message = f'Enter a file name to save the filtered data (or press "Enter" to use default name): '
327        InteractiveMode.saving_database(features.database, default_filename, message, suf='_filtered')
328
329        processed = InteractiveMode.run_preprocessing(features, 'PCA+UMAPND')
330
331        clusters = InteractiveMode.run_clusterization(processed)
332
333        message = 'Enter a file name to save the clustered data (or press "Enter" to use default name): '
334        InteractiveMode.saving_database(clusters.df, default_filename, message, suf='_clustered')
335
336        # Visualization
337        clusters.visualize_HDBSCAN(features.database)

Executes the full default processing pipeline:

  1. Feature filtering by variance
  2. Dimensionality reduction with PCA and UMAP
  3. Clustering with HDBSCAN
  4. Visualization
Parameters
  • features (ResNetFeatures): Input feature database object.
  • default_filename (str): Base filename for saving outputs.

430        Performs HDBSCAN clustering and sorts image files into corresponding folders.

 18class ServiceFuncs:
 19
 20    """
 21    A static utility class providing helper functions for file handling, 
 22    image validation, metadata processing, database I/O, and folder management.
 23
 24    This class is not meant to be instantiated.
 25
 26    Methods
 27    -------
 28    check_extension(file_path, allowed_extensions)
 29        Validates the file extension against allowed types.
 30
 31    load_info(info_path)
 32        Loads and processes observation metadata from a text file.
 33
 34    extract_observ_data(path, pattern)
 35        Extracts observation type and date from a file path using regex.
 36
 37    save_database(df, file_to_write, kind)
 38        Saves a pandas DataFrame to a file in pickle or JSON format.
 39
 40    read_database(file_to_read, kind)
 41        Reads a pandas DataFrame from a file.
 42
 43    preparing_folder(dir_name, clear)
 44        Prepares a directory, optionally clearing its contents.
 45
 46    split_into_two(df, excluded_columns)
 47        Splits a DataFrame into features and metadata parts.
 48
 49    input_name(input_path, pattern)
 50        Extracts a name ID from a path using regex.
 51    """
 52
 53    def __init__(self):
 54        raise RuntimeError('This class can not be instantiate.')
 55    
 56    @staticmethod
 57    def check_extension(file_path, allowed_extensions = ('.jpg', '.jpeg', '.png', '.bmp', '.tiff')):
 58        """
 59        Check if a file has one of the allowed extensions.
 60
 61        Parameters
 62        ----------
 63        file_path : str
 64            Path to the file.
 65        allowed_extensions : tuple of str, optional
 66            Tuple of allowed file extensions.
 67
 68        Returns
 69        -------
 70        bool
 71            True if the file has an allowed extension, False otherwise.
 72        """
 73        if not file_path.lower().endswith(allowed_extensions):
 74            return False
 75        return True
 76    
 77    @staticmethod
 78    def load_info(info_path):
 79        """
 80        Load and preprocess metadata from a space-delimited text file.
 81
 82        Parameters
 83        ----------
 84        info_path : str
 85            Path to the metadata file.
 86
 87        Returns
 88        -------
 89        pandas.DataFrame
 90            Parsed and enriched metadata, including date and sampling rate in kHz.
 91        """
 92        info = pd.read_csv(info_path, delimiter=' ')
 93        info['date'] = pd.to_datetime(info[['year', 'month', 'day']])
 94        info['SAMPLING_RATE[kHz]'] = info['SAMPLING_RATE[Hz]'].floordiv(1000)
 95        info.drop('SAMPLING_RATE[Hz]', axis=1, inplace=True)
 96        return info
 97    
 98    @staticmethod
 99    def extract_observ_data(path, pattern=r'(?:r|t)swf-e_(\d{4})(\d{2})(\d{2})'):
100        """
101        Extracts observation type and date from the filename using regex.
102
103        Parameters
104        ----------
105        path : str
106            File path or name.
107
108        Returns
109        -------
110        tuple
111            (observation_type, datetime.date)
112        
113        Raises
114        ------
115        ValueError
116            If the pattern is not found.
117        """
118        search = re.search(pattern, path)
119        if not search:
120            raise ValueError(f'Could not extract observation data from: {path}')
121        obs_type = search.group(1)
122        date = datetime.date(int(search.group(2)), int(search.group(3)), int(search.group(4)))
123        return obs_type, date
124    
125    @staticmethod
126    def save_database(df, file_to_write='./results/pearson_diagram_data', kind='pickle'):
127        """
128        Save a pandas DataFrame to disk.
129
130        Parameters
131        ----------
132        df : pandas.DataFrame
133            Data to save.
134        file_to_write : str
135            Base filename without extension.
136        kind : {'pickle', 'json'}
137            Format to save the file in.
138        save_dir : str
139            Directory to save the file to.
140
141        Raises
142        ------
143        Exception
144            If saving fails.
145        """
146        print(f'Saving the database to {file_to_write}')
147        try:
148            if kind == 'pickle':
149                df.to_pickle(file_to_write+'.pkl')
150            elif kind == 'json':
151                df.to_json(file_to_write+'.json')
152        except Exception as e:
153            print(f'Failed to save the database: {e}')
154
155    @staticmethod
156    def read_database(file_to_read='./results/pearson_diagram_data', kind='pickle', 
157                dtype={'obsertype': 'category', 'label': 'category', 'date': 'datetime'}):
158        """
159        Read a pandas DataFrame from a file.
160
161        Parameters
162        ----------
163        file_to_read : str
164            Base filename without extension.
165        kind : {'pickle', 'json'}
166            Format of the file.
167        dtype : dict
168            To set types of columns in the database.
169
170        Returns
171        -------
172        pandas.DataFrame or None
173            The loaded DataFrame, or None if reading failed.
174        """
175        print(f'Reading a database from a file {file_to_read}')
176        try:
177            if kind == 'pickle':
178                df = pd.read_pickle(file_to_read+'.pkl')
179            elif kind == 'json':
180                df = pd.read_json(file_to_read+'.json', dtype=dtype)
181            print(df.head())
182            print(df.dtypes)
183            return df
184        except Exception as e:
185            print(f'Error during reading a database: {e}')
186            return None
187        
188    @staticmethod
189    def preparing_folder(dir_name, clear):
190        """
191        Prepare a directory for output, optionally clearing its contents.
192
193        Parameters
194        ----------
195        dir_name : str
196            Path to the target directory.
197        clear : bool, optional
198            If True, the directory will be deleted and recreated.
199
200        Raises
201        ------
202        Exception
203            If directory manipulation fails.
204        """
205        if os.path.exists(dir_name):
206            if clear:
207                try:
208                    shutil.rmtree(dir_name)
209                    os.makedirs(dir_name)
210                except Exception as e:
211                    print(f'Error during deleting files in {dir_name}: {e}')
212        else:
213            os.makedirs(dir_name)
214
215    @staticmethod
216    def split_into_two(df, excluded_columns=None):
217        """
218        Split a DataFrame into features and metadata columns.
219
220        Parameters
221        ----------
222        df : pandas.DataFrame
223            Input DataFrame.
224        excluded_columns : list of str, optional
225            Columns to exclude from the features set.
226
227        Returns
228        -------
229        tuple of pandas.DataFrame
230            (features_df, metadata_df)
231        """
232        if excluded_columns is None:
233            excluded_columns=['dataset_name', 'date', 'dist_to_sun[au]', 'SAMPLES_NUMBER', 
234                          'SAMPLING_RATE[kHz]', 'SAMPLE_LENGTH[ms]', 'oldpath']
235        mask = [cols for cols in df.columns if cols not in excluded_columns]
236        df_features = df.loc[:, mask]
237        excluded_part = df.loc[:, excluded_columns]
238        return df_features, excluded_part
239
240    @staticmethod
241    def input_name(input_imags, pattern=r'images_(\w+)'):
242        """
243        Extract an identifier from a file path using a regular expression.
244
245        Parameters
246        ----------
247        input_path : str
248            File path or name.
249        pattern : str
250            Regular expression to extract the identifier.
251
252        Returns
253        -------
254        str
255            Extracted identifier or the original input if no match found.
256        """
257        search = re.search(pattern, input_imags)
258        if search:
259            return search.group(1)
260        else:
261            return input_imags

186            print(f'Error during reading a database: {e}')
187            return None
188        
189    @staticmethod
190    def preparing_folder(dir_name, clear):
191        """
192        Prepare a directory for output, optionally clearing its contents.
193
194        Parameters
195        ----------
196        dir_name : str
197            Path to the target directory.
198        clear : bool, optional
199            If True, the directory will be deleted and recreated.
200
201        Raises
202        ------
203        Exception
204            If directory manipulation fails.
205        """
206        if os.path.exists(dir_name):
207            if clear:
208                try:
209                    shutil.rmtree(dir_name)
210                    os.makedirs(dir_name)
211                except Exception as e:
212                    print(f'Error during deleting files in {dir_name}: {e}')
213        else:
214            os.makedirs(dir_name)

216    @staticmethod
217    def split_into_two(df, excluded_columns=None):
218        """
219        Split a DataFrame into features and metadata columns.
220
221        Parameters
222        ----------
223        df : pandas.DataFrame
224            Input DataFrame.
225        excluded_columns : list of str, optional
226            Columns to exclude from the features set.
227
228        Returns
229        -------
230        tuple of pandas.DataFrame
231            (features_df, metadata_df)
232        """
233        if excluded_columns is None:
234            excluded_columns=['dataset_name', 'date', 'dist_to_sun[au]', 'SAMPLES_NUMBER', 
235                          'SAMPLING_RATE[kHz]', 'SAMPLE_LENGTH[ms]', 'oldpath']
236        mask = [cols for cols in df.columns if cols not in excluded_columns]
237        df_features = df.loc[:, mask]
238        excluded_part = df.loc[:, excluded_columns]
239        return df_features, excluded_part

241    @staticmethod
242    def input_name(input_imags, pattern=r'images_(\w+)'):
243        """
244        Extract an identifier from a file path using a regular expression.
245
246        Parameters
247        ----------
248        input_path : str
249            File path or name.
250        pattern : str
251            Regular expression to extract the identifier.
252
253        Returns
254        -------
255        str
256            Extracted identifier or the original input if no match found.
257        """
258        search = re.search(pattern, input_imags)
259        if search:
260            return search.group(1)
261        else:
262            return input_imags

A static utility class providing helper functions for file handling, image validation, metadata processing, database I/O, and folder management.

This class is not meant to be instantiated.

Methods

check_extension(file_path, allowed_extensions) Validates the file extension against allowed types.

load_info(info_path) Loads and processes observation metadata from a text file.

extract_observ_data(path, pattern) Extracts observation type and date from a file path using regex.

save_database(df, file_to_write, kind) Saves a pandas DataFrame to a file in pickle or JSON format.

read_database(file_to_read, kind) Reads a pandas DataFrame from a file.

preparing_folder(dir_name, clear) Prepares a directory, optionally clearing its contents.

split_into_two(df, excluded_columns) Splits a DataFrame into features and metadata parts.

input_name(input_path, pattern) Extracts a name ID from a path using regex.

@staticmethod
def check_extension( file_path, allowed_extensions=('.jpg', '.jpeg', '.png', '.bmp', '.tiff')): 
57    @staticmethod
58    def check_extension(file_path, allowed_extensions = ('.jpg', '.jpeg', '.png', '.bmp', '.tiff')):
59        """
60        Check if a file has one of the allowed extensions.
61
62        Parameters
63        ----------
64        file_path : str
65            Path to the file.
66        allowed_extensions : tuple of str, optional
67            Tuple of allowed file extensions.
68
69        Returns
70        -------
71        bool
72            True if the file has an allowed extension, False otherwise.
73        """
74        if not file_path.lower().endswith(allowed_extensions):
75            return False
76        return True

Check if a file has one of the allowed extensions.

Parameters

  • allowed_extensions (tuple of str, optional): Tuple of allowed file extensions.
