@staticmethod
def load_info(info_path): 
78    @staticmethod
79    def load_info(info_path):
80        """
81        Load and preprocess metadata from a space-delimited text file.
82
83        Parameters
84        ----------
85        info_path : str
86            Path to the metadata file.
87
88        Returns
89        -------
90        pandas.DataFrame
91            Parsed and enriched metadata, including date and sampling rate in kHz.
92        """
93        info = pd.read_csv(info_path, delimiter=' ')
94        info['date'] = pd.to_datetime(info[['year', 'month', 'day']])
95        info['SAMPLING_RATE[kHz]'] = info['SAMPLING_RATE[Hz]'].floordiv(1000)
96        info.drop('SAMPLING_RATE[Hz]', axis=1, inplace=True)
97        return info

Load and preprocess metadata from a space-delimited text file.

Parameters
  • info_path (str): Path to the metadata file.
Returns
  • pandas.DataFrame: Parsed and enriched metadata, including date and sampling rate in kHz.
@staticmethod
def extract_observ_data(path, pattern='(?:r|t)swf-e_(\\d{4})(\\d{2})(\\d{2})'): 
 99    @staticmethod
100    def extract_observ_data(path, pattern=r'(?:r|t)swf-e_(\d{4})(\d{2})(\d{2})'):
101        """
102        Extracts observation type and date from the filename using regex.
103
104        Parameters
105        ----------
106        path : str
107            File path or name.
108
109        Returns
110        -------
111        tuple
112            (observation_type, datetime.date)
113        
114        Raises
115        ------
116        ValueError
117            If the pattern is not found.
118        """
119        search = re.search(pattern, path)
120        if not search:
121            raise ValueError(f'Could not extract observation data from: {path}')
122        obs_type = search.group(1)
123        date = datetime.date(int(search.group(2)), int(search.group(3)), int(search.group(4)))
124        return obs_type, date

Extracts observation type and date from the filename using regex.

Parameters
  • path (str): File path or name.
Returns
  • tuple: (observation_type, datetime.date)
Raises
  • ValueError: If the pattern is not found.

127    def save_database(df, file_to_write='./results/pearson_diagram_data', kind='pickle'):
128        """
129        Save a pandas DataFrame to disk.
130
131        Parameters
132        ----------
133        df : pandas.DataFrame
134            Data to save.
135        file_to_write : str
136            Base filename without extension.
137        kind : {'pickle', 'json'}
138            Format to save the file in.

141

143        ------
144        Exception
145            If saving fails.
146        """

149            if kind == 'pickle':
150                df.to_pickle(file_to_write+'.pkl')
151            elif kind == 'json':
152                df.to_json(file_to_write+'.json')
153        except Exception as e:
154            print(f'Failed to save the database: {e}')

@staticmethod
def read_database( file_to_read='./results/pearson_diagram_data', kind='pickle', dtype={'obsertype': 'category', 'label': 'category', 'date': 'datetime'}): 
156    @staticmethod
157    def read_database(file_to_read='./results/pearson_diagram_data', kind='pickle', 
158                dtype={'obsertype': 'category', 'label': 'category', 'date': 'datetime'}):
159        """
160        Read a pandas DataFrame from a file.
161
162        Parameters
163        ----------
164        file_to_read : str
165            Base filename without extension.
166        kind : {'pickle', 'json'}
167            Format of the file.
168        dtype : dict
169            To set types of columns in the database.
170
171        Returns
172        -------
173        pandas.DataFrame or None
174            The loaded DataFrame, or None if reading failed.
175        """
176        print(f'Reading a database from a file {file_to_read}')
177        try:
178            if kind == 'pickle':
179                df = pd.read_pickle(file_to_read+'.pkl')
180            elif kind == 'json':
181                df = pd.read_json(file_to_read+'.json', dtype=dtype)
182            print(df.head())
183            print(df.dtypes)
184            return df
185        except Exception as e:
186            print(f'Error during reading a database: {e}')
187            return None
